articles.description: The financial regulator has signalled the cap on banks' dividend payments might be scrapped as the country's economic outlook improves, triggering a jump in share prices of the big four lenders.
articles.content: Shares in the big four banks jumped in response to his remarks, leading gains on the ASX. Commonwealth Bank gained 2.9 per cent to $77.55, the highest closing price since early March. Westpac gained … [+2890 chars]

articles.author: Rachael Dexter, Paul Sakkal
articles.title: 'Chaos': South Australia lockdown sparks panic buying with toilet paper stripped from shelves - The Age
articles.description: South Australians are flocking to supermarkets ahead of the state's hard six-day lockdown, with queues stretching into car parks and shelves stripped of toilet paper.
articles.content:
Images and videos circulating on social media show long queues at supermarkets and shelves stripped bare of toilet rolls.
Panic buying started on Tuesday, a day ahead of Mr Marshall's lockdown annou… [+4742 chars]

articles.description: What the ‘W’ in Big W stands for

articles.title: National Australia Bank to reopen after hoax bomb threat - Sydney Morning Herald
articles.description: National Australia Bank closed its branches on Wednesday following a "physical security threat".
articles.content:
National Australia Bank branches across Australia will reopen on Thursday after a hoax bomb threat forced the closure of hundreds of banks.
